greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = numerator(r(n)) where r(n) = (((1/2)*(sqrt(3) + 1))^n - ((1/2)*(sqrt(3) - 1))^n * cos(Pi*n))/sqrt(3).
comment: Let f(x, y) = ((y+1)^x - (y-1)^x * cos(Pi*x))/(y * 2^x). Then f(n, sqrt(3)) are the rational numbers a(n)/A060723(n) and f(n, sqrt(5)) the Fibonacci numbers A000045(n).
The binomial inverse of the rational sequence r(n) starts 0, 1, -1, 3/2, -2, 11/4, -15/4, 41/8, -7, 153/16, -209/16, ... and is up to signs equal to r(n). The difference table starts:
formula: A recurrence for r(n) is given in A060723.
results.author: _Peter Luschny_, Jun 02 2018
